result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul Andrew Herman

records.addlTxt:
2:20 PM   Defendant in custody.  PFAC denied by the court.  Defendant remains pro se.
Good cause found to toll time limits.  Based on re-review of PFAC, court does find defendant eligible for court appointed counsel.
BAIL MOTION:   Argument by defendant.  Argument by Atty. Barros.  
Court:  Court amends defendant's cash bail from $500 to $2,000 personal recognizance bonds (covering both cases, 22CF631).   All conditions originally ordered remain intact.  Defendant shall have third-party contact with resident at 702 Chicago Street, Manitowoc, WI., but would stay at a friend's house on South 14th Street.  Notify the clerk's office within 24 hours of release as to the address he will be staying at.
Preliminary hearing rescheduled to:  11/10/22, 10:30 a.m., Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant in custody.    
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 10-05-22 at 1:30 p.m.  
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony bail jumping and possess Fentanyl.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-19-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
